notes: Hintz is questionable against the Kraken on Wednesday (Feb. 25) due to an illness, as per Robert Tiffin of D Magazine.
Lankinen is not expected to suit up against the Jets on Wednesday (Feb. 25), as per Jeff Paterson of CanucksArmy.com
Kapanen is expected to miss the first two games out of the Olympic break, as per Oilers TV reporter Paige Martin reports Sunday (Feb. 22).
Carlson is currently considered day-to-day due to a lower body injury, according to Tom Gulitti of NHL.com on Sunday (Feb. 22).
The Dallas Stars placed F Mikko Rantanen on the Injured Reserve.
The Rangers said on Friday (Feb. 20) that Rempe will undergo a procedure on his thumb and will be placed on injured reserve, per Peter Baugh of The Athletic.

The Blackhawks said that Dickinson left Thursday's (Feb. 19) practice session early due to an illness, per Ben Pope of the Chicago Sun-Times.
Crosby has been ruled out for Sunday's (Feb. 22) gold medal game against the United States at the 2026 Winter Olympics, as per Elliotte Friedman of Sportsnet.
Hedman is OUT for Wednesday's (Feb. 18) quarterfinals game versus Team USA because of a lower-body injury, per Pierre LeBrun of TSN.
Toffoli sustained a lower-body injury and is day-to-day, per Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now.
Faksa is considered Questionable for Wednesday's (Feb. 25) game against Seattle, as per Brien Rea of Victory+.
Sundqvist didn't participate in Tuesday's (Feb. 17) practice after he underwent surgery during the Olympic break, per Lou Korac of NHL.com.
The Los Angeles Kings placed F Kevin Fiala on injured reserve on Wednesday (Feb. 18).

Kuzmenko did not return to Thursday's (Feb. 5) game versus the Golden Knights.

Schwartz did not play Wednesday's (Feb. 4) game against the Kings due to a lower-body injury.
Dach did not return to Wednesday's (Feb. 4) game versus the Blue Jackets.

Panarin will link up with the Kings on Wednesday (Feb. 18) to prepare for the post-Olympics part of the schedule, per John Hoven of SiriusXM NHL Network Radio.

The Canucks said that Chytil sustained a facial fracture when he was struck by the puck during Wednesday's (Feb. 18) practice, and he's out indefinitely, Jeff Paterson of CanucksArmy.com
Foligno did not play in Wednesday's (Feb. 4) game versus the Predators.

Hoglander did not play in Wednesday's (Feb. 5) game against the Golden Knights.

Turcotte did not play in Thursday's (Feb. 5) game against the Golden Knights.
